page.title: 01 Landscape
page.content: The Bailey Hill_Garth area is hilly land in the middle Welsh Border Country. Situated, west of Knighton, in the County of Powys. The area is in the parishes of Knighton, Pilleth, Llangunllo and Heyope. There are no villages and it is sparsley populated except for the south eastern corner which is the north western fringe of Knighton. There are 14 farms,one larger house, Gwernaffel, a few cottages and some newer dwellings. One farm house is fairly new, replacing an older building. The houses on the edge Knighton are all of recent construction. Garth Hill rises to 320m. and the highest point on Bailey Hill, which is most of the area, is 393m. The land is good pasture and produces good sheep and beef cattle. There are some wooded areas, both decidious and coniferous.
